text: Which of the following cereal crops most requires nursery practices?
explanation: Maize, millet and guinea corn does not really require nursery.

text: The maturity period of groundnut in month is
explanation: Groundnut (Arachis hypogea) maturity period is between four to five months

text: Oil palm trees do well in soils with pH level of
explanation: Oil Palm (Elaeis guinensis) requires a pH scale of 5.5 to 6.5 i.e. it requires a pH scale which is acidic. Therefore, 5.5 - 6.5.

text: The optimum temperature for storing yam tuber under cold storage is
explanation: The optimum temperature for storing yam tuber under cold storage is 280K (7°C). Therefore, 7°C is correct.

text: Dura, Tenera and Pisifera are all cultivated varieties of
explanation: Dure, Tenera and Pisifera are cultivate varieties of oil palm. Choice B is correct.

text: Dura, Tenera and Pisifera are all cultivated varieties of
explanation: Dure, Tenera and Pisifera are cultivate varieties of oil palm. Choice B is correct.

text: The non-oil crop among the following is
explanation: Choice B, A and C are oil crops but choice D is a leguminous crop. Therefore, choice D is correct.

text: A variety of oil palm is
explanation: Tenera is a variety of oil palm. Choice C is correct

explanation: click here

text: Ideal pH for coffee cultivation is
explanation: The ideal pH of coffee is between 6.5 to 7.5. Therefore, choice D is correct.

text: Which of the following nutrient is highly immobile in plants?
explanation: Boron (B) is highly immobile because of its size. Therefore, choice A is correct.

text: Blast of rice is a
explanation: Blast of rice is a fungal disease. Therefore, choice C is correct.

text: A soil may be called as alkaline when the pH of the soil is more than
explanation: A soil may be called as alkaline when the pH of the soil is more than 7.0 pH scale than is less than 7.0 is acidic while pH scale that is greater than 7.0 is alkaline. pH scale that is equal to 7.0 is neutral. Therefore, choice C is correct.

text: Which of the following requires Silicon (Si) for its growth?
explanation: Rice (Oryza Sativa) needs Silicon (si) for its growth. Choice C is correct.

text: Phalaris minor is a crop associated wood with crop
explanation: Phalaris minor is a crop associated with wheat. Choice A is correct.

text: What is crop rotation?

options.A: Growing of crops one after the other in a particular sequence
options.B: Growing more than one crop at a time
options.C: Growing of an associate crop in between the rows of the main crop
options.D: Growing of crops together in strips

explanation: Choice A is correct. Crop rotation involves the growing of crops one after other in a particular sequence

text: The main mode of infection of rinderpest disease in cattle is through
explanation: The main made of infection of tinderpest disease is through inhalation of infected air by cattles. Choice D is correct

text: The pox disease in livestock are caused by
explanation: The pox diseases in livestock are caused by viruses. Choice B is correct

text: In poultry nutrition, the minerals that prevent the laying of thin-shelled eggs are
explanation: The minerals that prevents the laying of thin-shelled eggs are calcium and phosphorus (Ca and P).Thin-shelled eggs in poultry nutrition laid as a result of the deficiency of calcium and phosphorus. Therefore, choice A is correct.

text: In animal nutrition, iodine is essential for the production of
explanation: Iodine is essential for the production of thyroxine in animals. Therefore, choice B is correct.

text: The process of mating in sheep is termed
explanation: The process of mating in sheep is termed tupping. Choice C is correct.

text: Fertilizers are applied to fishponds to serve as
explanation: Fertilizers in fish farming are applied to fishponds to serve as nutrients for plankton. Choice C is correct.

text: Which of the following is not a breed of rabbits?
explanation: New zealand white, Chinchilla and californian white are breed of rabbits. Therefore, choice B is correct.

text: Which of the following is not a part of the reproduction system of a hen?
explanation: Ureter is the correct option. Therefore, choice D is correct

text: A good silage should be free of
explanation: Choice A is correct. A good silage must contain good nutrients, moisture and fibre.

text: The most unreliable source of power on the farm is
explanation: Choice B is the most unreliable source of farm power and choice B is wind.

text: The farm machinery used to sow seeds and apply fertilizer at the same time is
explanation: The farm machinery used to sow seeds and apply fertilizer at the same time is an harrow. Therefore, choice D is correct.

text: Which of the following is not a source of farm power?
explanation: Choice D is correct. Plough is not 2 source of farm power.

text: Farm survey equipment include the following except
explanation:
Achainin surveying, often referred to as asurveying chainormeasuring chain, is a tool used for measuring distances.
Adatunis a traditional tool used primarily for measuring distances in surveying. It often consists of a long, calibrated stick or rod, which can be used to measure distances between points on the ground. However, it is less common in modern surveying compared to other tools.

text: Which of the following required daily checking in a tractor?
explanation: The engine oil of a tractor requires daily checking. Therefore, choice B is correct

text: In order to eliminate food shortage, farm as should

options.C: shift from crop to animal production

explanation: In order to eliminate food shortage, farmers should cultivate more varieties of crops. Choice A is correct.

text: The following are importance of agriculture except

options.D: Provision of market for industrial goods

explanation: Choice C is correctAgriculture offers option A, B and D as benefits except C.

text: The following are the features of subsistence agriculture except

options.A: subsistence agriculture is mostly practised by peasant farms
options.B: It requires the use of family labour
options.C: Pests and diseases are not really controlled
options.D: It requires the use of both skilled and unskilled labour

explanation: Choice A, C and B explains the features of subsistence agriculture but option D did not state the feature of subsistence agriculture.Choice D is correct.

text: Which of the following is a type of land tenure system?
explanation: Option A is correct. There is no such thing as keyhold land tenure system or the system in choice C and D. The types of land tenure system are;i. Freehold systemii. Leasehold systemiii. Communal land tenure systemiv. Land tenure system by inheritance, e.t.c.There is no such thing as international land tenure system or land tenure system by theft. Therefore, choice A is correct.

text: Which of the following is not a branch of agriculture?
explanation: Kidding is not branch of agriculture. It is the act of giving birth in rabbits and goats. Choice C is correct

text: The demand for agricultural produce is generally
explanation: Choice B is correct. A price inelastic demand would mean that an increase in price would not necessarily lead to a decline in quantity demanded or in case it does proportion of quantity change would be lesser vis a vis the change in price.Demand tends to be price inelastic for agricultural produce for the following reasons.1. Price changes don't affect consumption much2. These produce are mostly necessities3. Possibility of postponement is not there for most of these produce

text: Rural farmers mostly obtain loans from
explanation: Choice D is correct because most rural farmers don't actually have access to merchant banks, IMF, government etc.

text: The type of labour available to peasant farmers is
explanation: The type of labour available to peasant farmers is family labour because most peasant farmers practise subsistence agriculture. Choice A is correct.

text: The factor of production whose reward is profit is
explanation: The factor of production whose reward is profit is entrepreneurship. The reward for land is rent, the reward for labour is wages or salaries while the reward for entrepreneur is profit and the reward for entrepreneur is profit and the reward for capital is interest. Therefore, choice D is correct.

text: The wear and tear of farm structures over time is described as
explanation: Choice B is correct. The wear and tear of farm structures overtime is described as depreciation

text: Soil texture can be refered to as

options.A: distribution of soil particles in a given sample
options.B: movement of water through the soil
options.C: Distribution of the different sizes of soil particles

explanation: Soil Texture is the classification of soil based on its physical texture and characteristics, particularly the size of the particles that make up the soil.

text: Which one of the following i not a target group of an agricultural Extension agent
explanation: Political parties are organized group of people with the same political ideology that fields candidates to contest in an election in order to win and implement their agenda.Other options are related to agriculture except political parties.

text: All but one are qualities of a good extension worker
explanation: A good Extension worker must have;organisational ability, clear judgement, initiative which qualities helps him to organize and interact with his target groups, but involvement in local politics is not a quality of a good extension worker.

text: Which one of these is not part of a disc plough
explanation: Planter is an equipment used in planting dead and it is only used after land preparation, where as disc plough is used for land preparation.

text: One major difference between disc plough and disc Harrow is

options.A: Disc plough is used to create wider ridges on the field than disc Harrow
options.B: A disc plough can have up to 54 discs on it at once whereas a disc harrow can have up to 6 disc
options.C: Disc plough is used to tilled the disc harrowed land
options.D: The disc part of plough is notched while that of harrow is round

explanation: Disc plough is used to create wider ridges on the field than disc harrow, because its disc are notched and about 54 discs can be used together at once, and also it is first used before disc harrow.

text: A castrated cockerel is called?
explanation: A castrated cockerel is referred to as capon

text: New Zealand is a breed of which animal?
explanation: New zealand is a breed of Rabbit

text: Newcastle disease is viral diseases that affect which animals?
explanation: Newcastle disease is an infection of domestic poultry and other bird species with virulent Newcastle disease virus (NDV).

text: All are factors to consider when planning a farmstead except?
explanation: Farm stead is the house belonging to a farm and the buildings around it, since it is not used for planting or cultivation, irrigation is not a factor to consider.

text: Legumes are different from grasses, because;

options.A: They have lesser protein content than grasses
options.B: They form symbiotic relationship with bacteria, rhizobian, in the nodules of their roofs

explanation: Legumes form symbiotic relationship with bacteria, rhizobium in the nodules of their roots to manufacture nitrogen compounds, which in turn serve as protein in the legumes, and seed being part of their storage form.

text: In which of the soil layer does most biological activity occur?
explanation: A - horizon is the top layer of the soil horizon, it contains decomposed organic matter which is necessary for plant growth and also microorganisms

text: All but one are related to surface irrigation?
explanation: Mole drainage is a subsurface method of draining clay soils that experience regular waterlogging from irrigation or high rainfall

text: All but one are related to surface irrigation?
explanation: Mole drainage is a subsurface method of draining clay soils that experience regular waterlogging from irrigation or high rainfall

text: The most effective method of controlling or preventing viral diseases in plants is by
explanation: Planting resistant varieties of a plant/crop is the most effective method of controlling or preventing viral diseases since, the varieties can resist viral infections.

text: Reduction of ten seedlings of maize to two per stand is referred to as
explanation: Thinning is the removal of some or parts of plants, to make room for the growth of others but does not involve the cutting of the whole tree.

text: The causative organism of maize rust is?
explanation: Maize rust is caused by a fungus called Puccinia sorghi.

text: Which of the following fruit is a capsule?
explanation: A capsule is a type of simple, dry, though rarely fleshy dehiscent fruit produced by many species of angiosperms. Only okra in the options is a capsule.

text: The Head of the tapeworm is known as the
explanation: The head of a tapeworm possesses structures like sucker, rostellum and hook, but the head collectively is referred to as Scolex.

text: Crops grown primarily for feeding animals are known as
explanation: Forage is a food such as grass or hay for horses and cattle [grazing livestock].

text: Which of the following is not a sign of heat in animals?
explanation: All other options except mucous discharge from the rectum which is a sign of sickness are signs of heat in animals.

text: The incubation period for turkey is
explanation: 27 days is the incubation period of turkey 21 days for chicken.

text: Which of the following is not a source of farm credit
explanation: Mortgage banks are banks that specializes in originating and / or servicing mortgage loans

text: Increase in farm produce is not usually improved by the

options.B: Increased use of manure and fertilizer
options.C: Improved sales of crop and livestock
options.D: Use of better farm equipment and tools

explanation: Improved sales of crop and livestock does not increase farm produce.

text: The commonest method of land tenure in Nigeria is
explanation: Land are popularly and commonly inherited in Nigeria, this has been the oldest and commonest land tenure in Nigeria.

text: If a crop requires 1.5kg phosphorus per hectare, how many kg of manure will be required per hectare is 1kg manure contains 0.32kg of phosphorus
explanation:
If 1kg manure = 0.32kg of phosphorusxkg manure = 1.5kg of phosphorus(Cross multiply)
x=1.50.32=4.69kgofmanure

text: The process whereby rocks are broken down into small particles through both physical and chemical factors is known as
explanation: Weathering is the process whereby rocks are broken down into small particles through factors such as rainfall, erosion etc.

text: The parent material of a soil is formed from the disintegration of
explanation: Parent materials are the weathered rock or sediment from which the soil was formed.

text: The following are the advantages of the sprinkler method of irrigation except

options.A: The system can be made automatic
options.B: They are portable making them suitable for use
options.C: Rate of application of irrigation water can be controlled
options.D: The method may be difficult for local farmers to use

explanation: The sprinkler system is automatic, portable and can easily be controlled, so it is NOT difficult for local farmers to use.

text: Which one of these is not an advantage of Newspaper as agricultural extension teaching methods?

options.A: It is restricted to only few literate farmer
options.B: The pictures they often carry serves as useful teaching aids
options.D: They can also be used in areas where there is no electricity

explanation: Newspaper can only be read by the literate farmers and majority of the farmers are ILLITERATE.

text: The degree of responsiveness of demand to change in the price of goods or produce is referred to as
explanation: Price Elasticity of demand is the degree of responsiveness of demand to changes in the price of goods or produce.

text: Which one of these is not a factor that affect change in supply of agricultural produce

options.B: Changes in the cost of production

explanation: Fixed cost does not affect the supply of agricultural produce.

text: The part of the ruminant stomach from which digestive juices secreted is the
explanation: Abomasium is the fourth stomach of ruminant animals and it is a secretary stomach, which secrets digestive juices, and also acid hydrolysis of microbial.

text: One of the symptoms of vitamin deficiency diseases in livestock includes except
explanation: Deficiency in vitamin cannot improve fertility rather it decreases it, leads to loss of appetite, scurvy and rickets.

text: Some of the by-products of fish include the following except
explanation: Leather cannot be gotten from fish, rather from cow, cattle, goat.

text: A crop not requiring more than 750mm annual rainfall is most suitable for cultivation in
explanation: Sahel savanna plants/crops requires between 600 - 900mm of rainfall.

text: Which of the following nutrient element is a micro-nutrient
explanation: Calcium is a macro nutrient [nutrients required by plant in large quantity, while the rest are micro nutrients [nutrients required in small quantity].

text: The type of soil formed is affected by the following factors except
explanation: All other options apart from farming systems affects the soil type, farming system only affects the soil texture.

text: The farm practices that does not have a very harmful effect on the soil is
explanation: Crop rotation is the practice of growing a series of dissimilar or different types of crops in the same area in sequenced seasons.

text: Maize grows best on
explanation: Loamy soil; this is the best soil for planting, because it contains all types of soil in the right proportion and required nutrients for growth of plant.

text: Which of the following is not a source of minerals in animal nutrition?
explanation: Palm oil
